//: Used comparison to other audited clips for this one.  Slightly longer than the 5 round clips, so changed values slightly to match.
description: A tiny piece of grooved metal designed to allow a shooter to quickly load ten 7.62x39mm rounds into a compatible firearm.

//: Based on Magpul 10 AK Magazine.  Audited with specs from a vendor.
description: A compact 10-round magazine for 7.62x39mm AK-pattern rifles, made of sturdy polymer.  Made for restricted civilian use.

//: Based on the Magpul 20 AK Magazine.  Audited with specs from a vendor.
description: A compact 20-round magazine for 7.62x39mm AK-pattern rifles, made of sturdy polymer.  Originally designed for tank crews.

//: Volume and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods. Based on: I.O. Inc. Waffle Pattern 30-round 7.62x39mm. Longest side from Internet resources.
description: A standard 30-round magazine for 7.62x39mm AK-pattern rifles, made of stamped sheet metal.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: An extended 40-round magazine for 7.62x39mm AK-pattern rifles, made of stamped sheet metal.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: A bulky 75-round drum magazine for 7.62x39mm AK-pattern rifles, made of stamped sheet metal.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods. Based on a pinned magazine.
description: A surplus Czechoslovak military magazine for the vz. 58 assault rifle, which has been modified to only be capable of holding 10 rounds in place of its standard capacity of 30 cartridges.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: An original surplus Czechoslovak magazine, constructed out of lightweight aluminum and made for use within vz. 58 pattern rifles and modern derivatives.  Despite strongly resembling standard Kalashnikov magazines, this curved box magazine is unsuitable for insertion into AK-pattern mag wells due to changes made in its follower assembly to facilitate a last-round-hold-open feature within the vz. 58.

A proprietary polymer box magazine, capable of containing 30 7.62x39mm rounds and compatible with the Czech Bren 2 carbine.  Unlike conventional 7.62x39mm magazines, this one is inserted straight up into the magazine well rather than rocked in, in order to facilitate a bolt-hold open mechanism.

//: Comparison method used with 30rd magazine as the base.  Length cut to 40% of 30rd for calculation.
description: A proprietary polymer box magazine, capable of containing 10 7.62x39mm rounds and compatible with the Czech Bren 2 carbine.  Unlike conventional 7.62x39mm magazines, this one is inserted straight up into the magazine well rather than rocked in, in order to facilitate a bolt-hold open mechanism.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: Engineered to allow the tapered 7.62x39mm cartridge to reliably cycle into the chamber of an appropriately converted firearm, this compact 5-round steel box magazine is compatible with AR-15-style rifles.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: Engineered to allow the tapered 7.62x39mm cartridge to reliably cycle into the chamber of an appropriately converted firearm, this compact 10-round steel box magazine is compatible with AR-15-style rifles.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: Engineered to allow the tapered 7.62x39mm cartridge to reliably cycle into the chamber of an appropriately converted firearm, this 20-round steel box magazine is compatible with AR-15-style rifles.

//: Dimensions and weight are from previous PR, not sure of methods.
description: Engineered to allow the tapered 7.62x39mm cartridge to reliably cycle into the chamber of an appropriately converted firearm and possessing a dramatic curve that looks laughably goofy, this 30-round steel box magazine is compatible with AR-15-style rifles.
